page.title: 02Background History
page.content: Mr.C.Jakes has made a{special study}of Prickwillow and the area. His family has been at Prickwillow for several generations. Mr Jakes house is built where the Old River bed used to be, the access road is called{Old Bank}and it winds along the old South River bank. 'This area was not drained completely until the beginning of the last Century. In the winter the River would flood its banks and make the land more fertile for farmers. The Cambridge to Norwich Line was built in 1845 on an embankment but this slipped because of the Peat. The{Padnal Signal Box}which can be seen by the Ely, Prickwillow road is leaning to one side as the land drops. The former School, Church, Pumping Engine Sheds and Vicarage are built on Piles. The Vicarage has 10 extra steps since it was built.
